Macros | Functions | Variables
ITM - Instrumentation Trace Macrocell
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for operating the Instrumentation Trace Macrocell (ITM) on Apollo5 devices. It supports trace port configuration, stimulus register operations, print functions, and trace synchronization for debugging and development tools.

Key Features

  1. Debug Tracing: Comprehensive debug trace functionality.
  2. Stimulus Ports: Multiple stimulus port operations.
  3. Trace Transmission: Real-time trace data transmission.
  4. TPIU Integration: Integration with Trace Port Interface Unit.
  5. Baud Rate: Configurable trace transmission baud rates.

Functionality

  • Enable and disable ITM functionality
  • Configure trace parameters and baud rates
  • Handle stimulus port operations
  • Manage trace data transmission
  • Integrate with TPIU for trace output

Usage

  1. Set ITM parameters using am_hal_itm_parameters_set()
  2. Enable ITM with am_hal_itm_enable()
  3. Configure stimulus ports and trace operations
  4. Handle trace data transmission
  5. Disable ITM when no longer needed

Configuration

  • Baud Rates: Configure trace transmission baud rates
  • Stimulus Ports: Set up stimulus port operations
  • TPIU Integration: Configure TPIU interface parameters
  • Trace Parameters: Set up trace data format and timing

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_itm_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_itm_disable ( void )

Disables the ITM.

This function completely disables the ARM ITM.

◆ am_hal_itm_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_itm_enable ( void )

Enables the ITM.

This function enables the ARM ITM.

◆ am_hal_itm_not_busy()

bool am_hal_itm_not_busy ( void )

Checks if itm is busy and provides a delay to flush the fifo.

This function determines whether ITM is busy.

Returns
True if not busy, false if busy (timed out or other error).

◆ am_hal_itm_parameters_set()

uint32_t am_hal_itm_parameters_set ( uint32_t ui32ItmBaud)
Parameters
ui32ItmBaud- Set to one of the following: AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_DEFAULT (1M) AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_2M AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_1M AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_115200 AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_230400 AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_460800 AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_500000 AM_HAL_TPIU_BAUD_57600
Note
The ui32ItmBaud parameter was formerly the parameter (and now deprecated) to the TPIU function, am_hal_tpiu_enable().

◆ am_hal_itm_sync_send()

void am_hal_itm_sync_send ( void )

Sends a Sync Packet.

Sends a sync packet. This can be useful for external software should it become out of sync with the ITM stream.

◆ am_hal_itm_tpiu_pipeline_flush()

uint32_t am_hal_itm_tpiu_pipeline_flush ( void )

Wait until the ITM/TPIU pipeline is clear.

Note
This function is not a status check. Instead, it waits for the SWO/ITM/TPIU print pipeline to be flushed, which can take significant time to complete or in some cases, to timeout.
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS = ITM and TPIU pipelines are flushed.

◆ am_hal_itm_trace_port_disable()

void am_hal_itm_trace_port_disable ( uint8_t ui8portNum)

Disable tracing on the given ITM stimulus port.

Parameters
ui8portNum

Disables tracing on the ports referred to by ui8portNum by writing the associated bit in the Trace Privilege Register in the ITM. The value for ui8portNum should be the logical OR one or more of the following values:

ITM_PRIVMASK_0_7 - disable ports 0 through 7 ITM_PRIVMASK_8_15 - disable ports 8 through 15 ITM_PRIVMASK_16_23 - disable ports 16 through 23 ITM_PRIVMASK_24_31 - disable ports 24 through 31

◆ am_hal_itm_trace_port_enable()

void am_hal_itm_trace_port_enable ( uint8_t ui8portNum)

Enables tracing on a given set of ITM ports.

Parameters
ui8portNum- Set ports to be enabled

Enables tracing on the ports referred to by ui8portNum by writing the associated bit in the Trace Privilege Register in the ITM. The value for ui8portNum should be the logical OR one or more of the following values:

ITM_PRIVMASK_0_7 - enable ports 0 through 7 ITM_PRIVMASK_8_15 - enable ports 8 through 15 ITM_PRIVMASK_16_23 - enable ports 16 through 23 ITM_PRIVMASK_24_31 - enable ports 24 through 31
